items.title: Praying for the family of 20 year-old Daunte Wright.
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Praying for the family of 20 year-old Daunte Wright.

Daunte Wright was killed in a Brooklyn Center police shooting near Minneapolis, sparking protests just miles away from where George Floyd was killed last May.

nbcnews.com

Minnesota police shooting of Daunte Wright sparks protests

Daunte Wright was killed in a Brooklyn Center police shooting near Minneapolis, sparking protests just miles away from where George Floyd was killed last May.Daunte Wright was killed in a Brooklyn Center police shooting near Minneapolis, sparking protests just miles away from where George Floyd was killed last May.

items.title: Great job!
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Great job!

+11Denver Public Schools

Students at Bruce Randolph School planted their first Big Green spring garden Friday - a small part of 'growing' opportunities in STEM education within DPS, whi...ch includes food/agriculture education!

Colorado State University is developing new concurrent enrollment opportunities for DPS students, and partnered with our district to bring the garden to life. The garden will bring fresh foods into the area, which is considered a food desert.

More from CBS Denver: https://denver.cbslocal.com/‚Ä¶/11/bruce-randolph-garden-den‚Ä¶/

See More

items.title: South players unveiled a mural, painted by local artist Delton...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

South players unveiled a mural, painted by local artist Delton Demarest, which depicts a smiling Davarie tossing a football into the air. His shirt reads: I AM DENVER SOUTH. The school plans to display the mural in its athletic department. South also crowned Armstrong as Homecoming King.

The No. 27 jersey on the Denver South football sideline this season contains a special power.

denverpost.com

Denver South football, undefeated in spring season, honors fallen teammate Davarie Armstrong

The No. 27 jersey on the Denver South football sideline this season contains a special power.The No. 27 jersey on the Denver South football sideline this season contains a special power.

items.title: Community,  I have received your emails regarding the proposed...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Community,

I have received your emails regarding the proposed start times coming in the 2021-2022 school year.

The Board of Education has NOT voted on this matter yet and I do not have enough information to provide a comprehensive response to your questions and concerns.

...

I have a meeting with the Superintendent on Monday and will bring this up with him to seek answers!

Feel free to email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

#TransDayOfVisibility

Learning for Justice

On this #TransDayOfVisibility and every day, we support all trans and nonbinary students and colleagues‚Äîout or not‚Äîfor who they know themselves to be. We contin...ue to work toward a world where this visibility is not legislated, but celebrated.

items.title: We struggle, yet again, to try and make sense of a senseless act...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

We struggle, yet again, to try and make sense of a senseless act of violence in our community. Our hearts break, yet again, for neighbors taken from us by guns and families ripped apart by bullets.

We send our love, our prayers, and our deepest condolences to our neighbors in Boulder. We stand alongside you for strength, recovery, and healing.

We also thank the Denver Police officers, and all first responders, who helped prevent further loss of life.

dpsk12.org

DPS Board of Education Statement on Boulder Shootings | Denver Public Schools

We struggle, yet again, to try and make sense of a senseless act of violence in our community. Our hearts break, yet again, for neighbors taken from us by guns and families ripped apart by bullets.We struggle, yet again, to try and make sense of a senseless act of violence in our community. Our hearts break, yet again, for neighbors taken from us by guns and families ripped apart by bullets.

items.title: DPS Board Director Tay Anderson was among those who voted to...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

DPS Board Director Tay Anderson was among those who voted to approve the Aug. 23 start, but he preferred a later start.

‚ÄúMy reluctance comes from hearing directly from parents and students in hot schools that are not comfortable coming back before August 30. I am grateful we moved to a date that towards the middle,‚Äù said Anderson. ‚ÄúI am now hoping other districts will start moving their calendar back to match DPS, so we can have a more uniform calendar around the state.‚Äù

DPS board members voted to start the 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year on Aug. 23 and 22, respectively. Board members hope the delayed start will provide some relief to schools without air conditioning.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Denver Public Schools Return To Classroom Later In August For Next 2 Years

DPS board members voted to start the 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year on Aug. 23 and 22, respectively. Board members hope the delayed start will provide some relief to schools without air conditioning.DPS board members voted to start the 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year on Aug. 23 and 22, respectively. Board members hope the delayed start will provide some relief to schools without air conditioning.

items.title: Last night five of my colleagues and I voted to renew several...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Last night five of my colleagues and I voted to renew several charter school contracts.

Some folks have called us ‚ÄúDemocrats for Education Reform‚Äù which couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth for some of us, especially me.

DFER-lite organizations spent hundreds of thousands of dollars against my candidacy in 2019 to prevent me from being elected and they failed.

...

My morals and values have not shifted from when I ran, but I was very clear on being against school closures as they cause trauma and displace families. We were presented with one set of recommendations from our staff and parents on the District Accountability Committee.

After hard deliberation, hours of calls with school leaders, and multiple school visits I made the best decision with the information before us and publicly called for an accountability system to hold charter schools accountable when they fail to meet the standards we‚Äôve placed before them.

Finally, I would be completely remiss if I ignored the fact that these same folks have remained silent on the constant attacks from those they are saying we are now aligned with. Some of these folks even attempted to run other candidates against me in 2019 and even said ‚ÄúThere is no way he can win citywide, because he‚Äôs 21 and Black.‚Äù

I refuse to cause trauma among thousands of students because they picked a school model that I don‚Äôt agree with. I must represent ALL 93,000 students in Denver Public School not only those that agree with my ideology.

Regardless of where you go to school, I am your Director and will represent you.

See More

items.title: Denver Public Schools issued a statement last night  in regards...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver Public Schools issued a statement last night in regards to the domestic terrorist attack in Atlanta on Tuesday.

Late Tuesday, eight people were murdered in Atlanta, Georgia and six of those individuals were Asian American women. These crimes are being investigated but appear to be racially motivated. For many of us, these murders bring to light the trauma, hate, and violence that Asian Americans are experiencing in our country. And this must stop.

We have marked the... one year anniversary of a world-wide pandemic that has taken 500,000 lives in America and disrupted the lives of every student and family in the District. In this same timeframe, hateful rhetoric and violence against Asian Americans has festered and grown. In this past year, over 3,800 xenophobic and racialized attacks against Asian Americans (mostly women and elderly) have been reported.

These racialized attacks against Asian Americans reflect our country‚Äôs painful and often overlooked historical mistreatment of Asian Americans, including the Chinese exclusion and Japanese incarceration. In Denver, we are mere steps away from the state‚Äôs Ralph Carr Justice Center, named for the former Colorado Governor who courageously refused to send Coloradans of Japanese descent to the federal incarceration camps during World War II. At the time under great political pressure, Governor Carr stated, ‚ÄúIf you harm them, you must first harm me.‚Äù

Racism has no place in our district. We are a district grounded in Equity. We are committed to ensuring our schools are Safe and Welcoming for all. And we stand with our Asian American students, staff, and families. We condemn these heinous acts of violence and hateful rhetoric. And we are committed to creating a safe place for our Asian American students and staff to learn and thrive.

See More

items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

This page believes and promotes Black Lives Matter.

items.title: Last night we had someone come to our school board meeting...
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson updated their status.

Last night we had someone come to our school board meeting spewing lies about Black Lives Matter and how it doesn‚Äôt support ‚Äúfamily values‚Äù and called it ‚Äúmarxist‚Äù organization.

They also mentioned they didn‚Äôt find anywhere on the DPS website our support for Black Lives Matter.

I think I can speak freely for both DPS and the Board when I say this, we believe that Black Lives Matter and will support our Black educators and students in whatever way they need.

...

Remember All lives can‚Äôt matter until Black Lives Matter.

See More

items.title: Knock Knock ... PROM IS HERE!
items.content_html:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Knock Knock ... PROM IS HERE!

It may not look like the prom pre-pandemic, but Colorado students will likely be able to attend the traditional spring dance this year.

thedenverchannel.com

The prom is back: Colorado schools receive guidance for 2021

It may not look like the prom pre-pandemic, but Colorado students will likely be able to attend the traditional spring dance this year.It may not look like the prom pre-pandemic, but Colorado students will likely be able to attend the traditional spring dance this year.
